intro: Louteridium, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Melanthiaceae. It consists of several species that are native to various regions in Europe and Asia. The plants typically have dark green, lance-shaped leaves and produce clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. They are often found in woodland areas and are adapted to moist, shady environments. Louteridium species are noted for their ornamental value and are sometimes cultivated in gardens.
